Define Project Scope.instructions: Identify and analyze all stakeholders who will be impacted by or have influence over the project.
Define Project Scope.approach: Create a stakeholder register, conduct interviews or surveys, and assess stakeholder influence and interest.

Define Project Scope.instructions: Create a document that formally authorizes the project and outlines its key elements.
Define Project Scope.approach: Collaborate with the project sponsor to define project purpose, objectives, scope, deliverables, and high-level requirements.

Define Project Scope.instructions: Assess the viability of the project from technical, economic, and operational perspectives.
Define Project Scope.approach: Conduct research, analyze data, and prepare a report outlining the project's feasibility and potential risks.

Assemble Project Team.instructions: Determine the roles and skills necessary for successful project completion.
Assemble Project Team.approach: Review project scope, create a skills matrix, and consult with department heads to identify suitable team members.

Assemble Project Team.instructions: Select and onboard team members based on the identified roles and skills.
Assemble Project Team.approach: Conduct interviews, review resumes, and negotiate with functional managers to secure team members.

Develop Project Management Plan.instructions: Break down the project into smaller, manageable components.
Develop Project Management Plan.approach: Organize a team workshop to identify deliverables and work packages, then create a hierarchical structure.

Develop Project Management Plan.instructions: Create a detailed timeline of project activities and milestones.
Develop Project Management Plan.approach: Use the WBS to identify tasks, estimate durations, determine dependencies, and create a Gantt chart.

Develop Project Management Plan.instructions: Determine the project budget based on estimated costs for all activities.
Develop Project Management Plan.approach: Gather cost estimates for resources, materials, and services, then create a budget baseline.

Develop Project Management Plan.instructions: Identify potential risks and create strategies to mitigate or respond to them.
Develop Project Management Plan.approach: Conduct a risk identification workshop, assess probability and impact, and develop response strategies.

Plan for Quality.instructions: Establish the quality criteria and standards for project deliverables.
Plan for Quality.approach: Review industry standards, consult with stakeholders, and document quality requirements for each deliverable.

Plan for Quality.instructions: Create processes to ensure project activities meet quality standards.
Plan for Quality.approach: Define quality control checkpoints, create checklists, and establish review and approval processes.

Direct and Manage Project Work.instructions: Officially start the project execution phase with all team members and key stakeholders.
Direct and Manage Project Work.approach: Prepare an agenda, present the project plan, clarify roles and responsibilities, and address any initial concerns.

Direct and Manage Project Work.instructions: Execute the tasks outlined in the project management plan.
Direct and Manage Project Work.approach: Assign work packages, provide resources, and ensure team members understand their responsibilities and deadlines.

Direct and Manage Project Work.instructions: Ensure effective and timely communication among team members and stakeholders.
Direct and Manage Project Work.approach: Implement a communication plan, conduct regular team meetings, and provide project status updates.

Perform Quality Assurance.instructions: Regularly review project processes and deliverables to ensure they meet quality standards.
Perform Quality Assurance.approach: Schedule and perform audits, document findings, and recommend corrective actions if necessary.

Perform Quality Assurance.instructions: Identify and implement ways to improve project processes and outcomes.
Perform Quality Assurance.approach: Encourage team feedback, analyze performance data, and implement approved improvement suggestions.

Monitor and Control Project Work.instructions: Regularly assess the project's progress against the planned schedule and milestones.
Monitor and Control Project Work.approach: Update the project schedule, track completed tasks, and identify any deviations from the plan.

Monitor and Control Project Work.instructions: Control changes to the project scope, schedule, or budget.
Monitor and Control Project Work.approach: Implement a change control process, evaluate change requests, and update project documents as necessary.

Monitor and Control Project Work.instructions: Continuously identify, assess, and respond to project risks.
Monitor and Control Project Work.approach: Regularly review and update the risk register, implement risk responses, and monitor their effectiveness.

Report Performance.instructions: Create and distribute regular reports on project progress, issues, and performance metrics.
Report Performance.approach: Gather data from team members, analyze project metrics, and compile information into a clear, concise report.

Report Performance.instructions: Evaluate team and individual performance against project objectives and KPIs.
Report Performance.approach: Schedule regular review meetings, provide constructive feedback, and document performance assessments.

Close Project or Phase.instructions: Ensure all project deliverables have been completed and accepted by stakeholders.
Close Project or Phase.approach: Review project scope statement, obtain formal acceptance from stakeholders, and document any incomplete items.

Close Project or Phase.instructions: Gather feedback from the team and stakeholders on project successes and areas for improvement.
Close Project or Phase.approach: Organize a workshop, encourage open discussion, and document insights for future projects.

Close Project or Phase.instructions: Collect and organize all project documentation for future reference.
Close Project or Phase.approach: Review all project files, ensure they are properly labeled and stored, and create an index for easy retrieval.

Release Resources.instructions: Formally release team members from the project and provide performance feedback.
Release Resources.approach: Conduct individual closeout meetings, provide written evaluations, and notify functional managers of release dates.

Release Resources.instructions: Finalize and close all project-related contracts and agreements.
Release Resources.approach: Review contract terms, ensure all obligations have been met, obtain formal acceptance, and process final payments.

Prepare Final Report.instructions: Gather and analyze data on project performance, including schedule, budget, and quality metrics.
Prepare Final Report.approach: Review all project documentation, collect final performance data, and analyze variances from the original plan.

Prepare Final Report.instructions: Create a comprehensive report summarizing the project's performance, outcomes, and lessons learned.
Prepare Final Report.approach: Synthesize project data and insights, write a clear and concise report, and distribute to stakeholders.
